result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grant Norman Rissley

defendant.name: Rissley, Grant Norman
defendant.address: 10585 South Chicago Road, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Grant N Rissley in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Grant N Rissley.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Defense cannot proceed with the DPA today as the defendant was unable to get the TAD evaluation completed. Defense informs the court that this case may resolve through a plea and sentencing. Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Pretrial Services Status Report
Defendant made up missed telephone contact

Defendant Grant Norman Rissley in Court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in Court for Grant Norman Rissley.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant has FOUR Cases pending in Branch 15: 21CM2620, 22CM1605, 21CT1620, and 22CM1558. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of Deferred Prosecution Agreement (DPA) and requested time for Defendant to be evaluated. State confirmed. Court granted request. Court ordered case adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement (DPA) hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated August 30, 2022; received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
No contact order with CR and NR modified to a no violent contact order.  All other previously ordered terms and conditions remain in full effect.

Defendant Grant Norman Rissley in court with Attorney Haley E Wentz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  State moves the Court to amend the no contact order to a no violent contact order.  Defense does not object.  Court grants request.  Court set a scheduling conference date.  This matter will be held in room 623 of the Courthouse.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-20-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CMR; NR

Defendant Grant Norman Rissley in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Grant Norman Rissley in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Grant Norman Rissley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
